Please provide a clear and concise description of your changes.

## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Code refactoring
- [ ] Test improvements
- [ ] Other (please describe):

## Code Quality

- [ ] I have run `ruff format .` to format the code
- [ ] I have run `ruff check .` and fixed all issues
- [ ] I have run `mypy morphml` and addressed type errors
- [ ] I have run the test suite (`pytest`) and all tests pass
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly

## Documentation

- [ ] I have updated docstrings for new/modified functions
- [ ] I have added examples for new features
- [ ] I have updated README.md (if needed)
- [ ] I have updated relevant documentation in `docs/`

Does this change affect performance?

- [ ] No performance impact
- [ ] Performance improvement (please describe)
- [ ] Potential performance regression (please describe)

## Breaking Changes

Does this PR introduce any breaking changes?

- [ ] No breaking changes
- [ ] Yes, breaking changes (please describe below)

- What breaks?
- How should users update their code?
- Is there a migration guide?

## Checklist

- [ ] My code follows the project's coding standards
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published

Add any additional notes or context for reviewers here.

## Reviewer Guidelines

**For reviewers:**

- [ ] Code quality and style
- [ ] Tests are adequate
- [ ] Documentation is clear
- [ ] No performance regressions
- [ ] Backwards compatibility maintained (or breaking changes justified)
